title: 2 Easy Ways to Change the Theme on Google Chrome

steps.title: Open a new tab in Google Chrome.
steps.content: Open a new tab in Google Chrome. In Google Chrome , you can customize the background for new tabs and the color of your browser. Make sure to update Chrome to the latest version.

steps.title: Click Customize Chrome.
steps.content: Click Customize Chrome . You can find this at the bottom-right corner of the new tab page. This may also look like a pencil icon. A panel will open on the right.

steps.title: Click Change theme.
steps.content: Click Change theme . Theme refers to the background of your new tab page.

steps.title: Select a background photo.
steps.content: Select a background photo. Choose a category to view the backgrounds. To use a photo saved to your device, click Upload an image . Select the image, and then click Open . Click the back arrow to return to the Appearance window.

steps.title: Select a color theme for your browser.
steps.content: Select a color theme for your browser. This will change the color of the top menu bar, buttons, and any other visible elements of the browser (excluding the webpage). If you want to revert back to the original theme, click Reset to Default Chrome underneath the color theme options.

steps.title: Click ⋮ in the top-right corner.
steps.content: Click ⋮ in the top-right corner. You can browse the Chrome Web Store for more themes made by other users. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Click Settings.
steps.content: Click Settings . This is towards the bottom of the pop-up menu.

steps.title: Click Appearance.
steps.content: Click Appearance . You can find this in the left panel.

steps.title: Click the arrow next to "Theme".
steps.content: Click the arrow next to "Theme". This is at the top of the page, underneath the Appearance header. The Chrome Web Store will open.

steps.title: Select a theme.
steps.content: Select a theme. You can browse the sections on the left or scroll down to see specific collections.

steps.title: Click Add to Chrome.
steps.content: Click Add to Chrome . This is similar to adding extensions . The theme will be applied to Chrome immediately. If you change your mind, click Undo at the top. To remove a downloaded theme, click ⋮ next to the search bar and click My extensions & themes . Select Remove next to the theme.
